body:
> Yeah, I don't think this is really testable. I also think it doesn't matter much - AIUI all this fixes is people who change the update channel via preference overrides in a distribution file (or through some other way change it on the default pref branch, but haven't recompiled) there's got to be very very few of those people, right? Or am I missing something?

Our current method of determining the channel returns `release` for release candidate builds on Beta, which has been interrupting experiments running on Beta. Experiments that want to run on Beta while rc builds are out need to change their filters during that week to only match users on beta with a specific version, and then we have to switch the filter back and still risk losing users.

Without this it's very finnicky at best to run an uninterrupted experiment on Beta unless it's less than 5 weeks and runs early in the cycle.
